content: on top of hat with the join of the hat lined up with the center st of his chin pull black loop up through the center st ch3 double_crochet round through both layers there are 10 more stitches on the hat than jack to even them out work twice into every 3 round st on the top layer passing your hook over into the next double_crochet on the back on the second stitch join give the whole piece several tugs to get jack to stretch out change to white child size work in stripes of double_crochet rounds until hat measures 5 inches or 1 inch less than desired length last round change to sm hook rib alternate fpdc and bpdc around end off cut yarn xsmall beanie only r7 double_crochet around increase to 66 stitches work in stripes of double_crochet rounds until hat measures 6 inches or 1 inch less than desired length for beanie and 7 inches for slouchy last round change to sm hook rib alternate fpdc and bpdc around end off cut yarn small medium large sizes r7 chain 2 double_crochet 2 double_crochet in the next st around join 72 sts r8 chain 2 change to black double_crochet around join small beanie r9 to 14 chain 2 double_crochet around join chain 2 turn alternate stripes of white and black slouch work 2 more rounds of stripe before last round of rib medium r9 change to white double_crochet around increasing 6 sts evenly spaced around join 78sts beanie r10 to 15 chain 2 double_crochet around alternating black and white join slouch work 2 more rounds of stripe before last round of rib large r9 change to white double_crochet around increasing 10 sts evenly spaced around join 82 sts beanie r10 to 16 chain 2 double_crochet around alternating black and white join slouch work 2 more rounds of stripe before last round of rib last round all sizes change to sm hook rib alternate 1 fpdc 1 bpdc around join end off cut yarn weave in any loose ends
